alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 3:11PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York and central, northeast and northwest Vermont. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Amounts will be elevation dependent. Temperatures above freezing may initially limit accumulations to grassy, elevated surfaces tonight. Snow may be briefly heavy, which may lead to localized power outages, with the most likely region being higher elevations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton
